query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Io era già da quell’ ombre partito, 2 e seguitava l’orme del mio duca, 3 quando di retro a me, drizzando ’l dito,
query.error: **English:** 1 I had already departed from those shadows, 2 and was following the footsteps of my guide, 3 when behind me, pointing his finger,
query.result: 1 Ic wæs ða fram ðæm sceаdum faren, 2 and folgode ðæs lærendes sporum, 3 ða æfter me, his finger teonde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 una gridò: «Ve’ che non par che luca 5 lo raggio da sinistra a quel di sotto, 6 e come vivo par che si conduca!».
query.error: **English:** 4 someone cried out: "See how the ray from the left 5 does not seem to shine on the one below, 6 and how he seems to walk as if he were alive!"
query.result: 4 hrymde sum: "Loca, ne mæg ðæt leoht 5 ðæs wæteres gleam of ðæm wynstran beorgan, 6 and he lyfigende hine lædeð!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Li occhi rivolsi al suon di questo motto, 8 e vidile guardar per maraviglia 9 pur me, pur me, e ’l lume ch’era rotto.
query.error: **English:** 7 I turned my eyes at the sound of this utterance, 8 and I saw her looking in wonder 9 only at me, only at me, and at the light that was broken.
query.result: 7 Þa ic mine eagan up gewende 8 and geseah ða wundrigende 9 me, me, and ðæt leoht ðe wæs torrofen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 «Perché l’animo tuo tanto s’impiglia», 11 disse ’l maestro, «che l’andare allenti? 12 che ti fa ciò che quivi si pispiglia?
query.error: **English:** 10 "Why is your spirit so entangled," 11 said the master, "that you slow your pace? 12 What makes you heed the whispering here?
query.result: 10 "Hwi is ðin mod swa miclum geblissod," 11 cwæð se lareow, "ðæt ðu ðone gang ne ofest? 12 Hwæt ðe ðincas ðæt ðu her gehyrst?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Vien dietro a me, e lascia dir le genti: 14 sta come torre ferma, che non crolla 15 già mai la cima per soffiar di venti;
query.error: **English:** 13 Come after me, and let people talk: 14 stand like a firm tower, whose top 15 never sways in the wind;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 ché sempre l’omo in cui pensier rampolla 17 sovra pensier, da sé dilunga il segno, 18 perché la foga l’un de l’altro insolla».
query.error: **English:** 16 for the man in whom thought surges 17 upon thought, drives the mark further away, 18 because one thought hampers the other."
query.result: 16 forðæm ðe ðæs monnes mod ðe oft geþohte 17 ofer geþoht, ðone stede gehealdeð, 18 forðæm ðe ðæs anes ðæs oðres ne gifeð."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Che potea io ridir, se non «Io vegno»? 20 Dissilo, alquanto del color consperso 21 che fa l’uom di perdon talvolta degno.
query.error: **English:** 19 What could I say, except “I am coming”? 20 I said it, somewhat pale in color, 21 which sometimes makes a man worthy of forgiveness.
query.result: 19 Hwæt mihte ic ða sprecan, buton “Ic cume”? 20 Ic ðæt sæde, sumes ðæs hiwes gewanod, 21 ðe ðone wer oft ðæs forgifnesse wyrðne geðeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 E ’ntanto per la costa di traverso 23 venivan genti innanzi a noi un poco, 24 cantando ‘Miserere’ a verso a verso.
query.error: **English:** 22 And meanwhile, along the hillside, 23 some people were coming towards us, 24 singing ‘Miserere’ verse by verse.
query.result: 22 And ða ðurh ðone munt be þam sidan 23 com folc ongeagn us lyt, 24 singende ‘Miserere’ fers forð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Quando s’accorser ch’i’ non dava loco 26 per lo mio corpo al trapassar d’i raggi, 27 mutar lor canto in un «oh!» lungo e roco;
query.error: **English:** 25 When they realized that I was not giving way 26 with my body to the passage of the rays, 27 they changed their song to a long and hoarse "Oh!";

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 e due di loro, in forma di messaggi, 29 corsero incontr’ a noi e dimandarne: 30 «Di vostra condizion fatene saggi».
query.error: **English:** 28 and two of them, in the form of messengers, 29 ran to meet us and asked us: 30 "Tell us about your condition."
query.result: 28 and twegen heora, on gesceapum ærenda, 29 urnon us togeanes and us ðus trymedon: 30 "Secgað unc eowre gecynd."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 E ’l mio maestro: «Voi potete andarne 32 e ritrarre a color che vi mandaro 33 che ’l corpo di costui è vera carne.
query.error: **English:** 31 And my master: "You can go 32 and report to those who sent you 33 that this man's body is real flesh.
query.result: 31 And min lareow: "Ge magon faran 32 and secgan ðam ðe eow hider sendon 33 ðæt ðisses mannes lichama is soð flæsc."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Se per veder la sua ombra restaro, 35 com’ io avviso, assai è lor risposto: 36 fàccianli onore, ed esser può lor caro».
query.error: **English:** 34 If they remain to see his shade, 35 as I believe, they have been answered enough: 36 let them honor him, and he may be dear to them."
query.result: 34 Gif hie willað his sceadu geseon, 35 swa ic wene, him is wel andwyrd: 36 do him ða weorðunga, and he him bið leof."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Vapori accesi non vid’ io sì tosto 38 di prima notte mai fender sereno, 39 né, sol calando, nuvole d’agosto,
query.error: **English:** 37 I never saw vapors so inflamed 38 cleave the serene air at the first hour of night, 39 nor clouds of August at sunset,
query.result: 37 Ne geseah ic næfre fyres blæst swa hræd 38 æt frumsceaft nihtes fleogan on heofonum, 39 ne, sigel snyriende, sunnan setlganges,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 che color non tornasser suso in meno; 41 e, giunti là, con li altri a noi dier volta, 42 come schiera che scorre sanza freno.
query.error: **English:** 40 that they did not turn red again above; 41 and, having arrived there, they wheeled around with the others toward us, 42 like a troop that runs without rein.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 «Questa gente che preme a noi è molta, 44 e vegnonti a pregar», disse ’l poeta: 45 «però pur va, e in andando ascolta».
query.error: **English:** 43 "These people who press upon us are many, 44 and they come to pray to you," said the poet: 45 "but still go on, and listen as you go."
query.result: 43 "Þeos meniu ðe ðringð to us is fela, 44 and cumað to ðe biddan," cwæð se scop: 45 "ac ðeah ðu ga, and on gonge gehyr."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 «O anima che vai per esser lieta 47 con quelle membra con le quai nascesti», 48 venian gridando, «un poco il passo queta.
query.error: **English:** 46 "O soul who go to be joyful 47 with those limbs with which you were born," 48 they came crying, "slow your pace a little.
query.result: 46 "Eala ðu sawl ðe gæst ðurh ðone lichoman 47 ðe ðu mid geboren wære," 48 cwædon ða clypigende, "þin færelt hwonlice."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Guarda s’alcun di noi unqua vedesti, 50 sì che di lui di là novella porti: 51 deh, perché vai? deh, perché non t’arresti?
query.error: **English:** 49 See if you ever saw any of us, 50 so that you can carry news of him from here: 51 oh, why do you go? Oh, why don’t you stop?
query.result: 49 Loca hwaðer ðu æfre gesawe sumne, 50 ðæt ðu ðær ðone bodan brohte: 51 a, hwi gæst ðu? a, hwi ne stentest ðu?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Noi fummo tutti già per forza morti, 53 e peccatori infino a l’ultima ora; 54 quivi lume del ciel ne fece accorti,
query.error: **English:** 52 We were all once forcibly killed, 53 and sinners until the very last hour; 54 here, a light from heaven made us aware,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 sì che, pentendo e perdonando, fora 56 di vita uscimmo a Dio pacificati, 57 che del disio di sé veder n’accora».

query.result: 55 ðæt we ðurh ðone hreowsunge and ðurh ða forgifnesse, 56 of ðissum life eodon Gode geþafunge, 57 ðe ðæs wilnunga his gesyhðe us getrymð.

query.result: 58 And ic: "Hwi ne oncnawe ic ænigne 59 on eowrum andwlitum? Ac gif hit eow licað 60 ænig ðing ðæt ic mæg, gastas wel geborene,

61 voi dite, e io farò per quella pace 62 che, dietro a’ piedi di sì fatta guida, 63 di mondo in mondo cercar mi si face».
query.error: **English:** 61 that I can do, I will do it for that peace 62 which makes me search from world to world 63 behind the footsteps of such a guide."
query.result: 61 secgað, and ic wille wyrcan for ðære sibbe 62 ðe, æfter ðæs swiðran lareowes fotum, 63 of worulde to worulde me secan deð."

query.prompt:

64 E uno incominciò: «Ciascun si fida 65 del beneficio tuo sanza giurarlo, 66 pur che ’l voler nonpossa non ricida.

query.result: 64 And an ða ongan ðus secgan: "Æghwylc ðe ðurh ðine gife truweð 65 butan aðe, ðe ðin willa næfre ne mæg awendan. 66 ðæt ðu ðone nelt forgolden ðe ðe ðus fæste lufað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Ond’ io, che solo innanzi a li altri parlo, 68 ti priego, se mai vedi quel paese 69 che siede tra Romagna e quel di Carlo,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 che tu mi sie di tuoi prieghi cortese 71 in Fano, sì che ben per me s’adori 72 pur ch’i’ possa purgar le gravi offese.
query.error: **English:** 70 that you be courteous with your prayers for me 71 in Fano, so that they pray well for me 72 so that I may purge my grave offenses.
query.result: 70 ðæt ðu sy ðinra gebedena milde 71 on Fane, ðæt hi wel for me gebiddon 72 ðæt ic mote ða hefigan synna gebetan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Quindi fu’ io; ma li profondi fóri 74 ond’ uscì ’l sangue in sul quale io sedea, 75 fatti mi fuoro in grembo a li Antenori,
query.error: **English:** 73 Then I was; but the deep ditches 74 from which the blood flowed on which I sat 75 were made for me in the circle of the Antenori,
query.result: 73 Þa wæs ic; ac ða deopan dicas 74 ðanon ðæt blod com on ðam ic sæt, 75 geworhte wæron me on ðara Antenora,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 là dov’ io più sicuro esser credea: 77 quel da Esti il fé far, che m’avea in ira 78 assai più là che dritto non volea.
query.error: **English:** 76 where I thought I was most secure: 77 he of Este had it done, who held me in hate 78 far more than justice wished.
query.result: 76 ðær ic wende wæron wærlicran: 77 ðæt dyde ða ðara ðe of Este wæs, ðe me on innan 78 micle ma ðonne riht wæs gram wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Ma s’io fosse fuggito inver’ la Mira, 80 quando fu’ sovragiunto ad Orïaco, 81 ancor sarei di là dove si spira.
query.error: **English:** 79 But if I had fled towards the Mira, 80 when I was overtaken at Oriaco, 81 I would still be on the side where one breathes.
query.result: 79 Ac gif ic ða flugon ofer ða Mire, 80 ða ða ic oferfaren wæs æt ðam Oryacum, 81 ðonne wære ic gyt ðær ðær mon lif gæst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Corsi al palude, e le cannucce e ’l braco 83 m’impigliar sì ch’i’ caddi; e lì vid’ io 84 de le mie vene farsi in terra laco».
query.error: **English:** 82 I ran to the marsh, and the reeds and the mud 83 entangled me so that I fell; and there I saw 84 my veins forming a pool on the ground.
query.result: 82 Ic urnon ða to ðam mere, and ða reodas and ðæt lacu 83 me besæton swa ðæt ic feoll; and ðær ic ða geseah 84 of minum adrum ðone lacu on ðære eorðan geweorðan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Poi disse un altro: «Deh, se quel disio 86 si compia che ti tragge a l’alto monte, 87 con buona pïetate aiuta il mio!
query.error: **English:** 85 Then another said: "Oh, may that desire 86 be fulfilled that draws you to the high mountain, 87 with good piety help mine!
query.result: 85 Þa cwæð oðer: "Ea, gif ðæt gewilnung 86 geweorðeð þe ðe tihð to ðam hean munte, 87 mid godre mildheortnesse gefylst ðu minne!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 E io a lui: «Qual forza o qual ventura 92 ti travïò sì fuor di Campaldino, 93 che non si seppe mai tua sepultura?».
query.error: **English:** 91 And I to him: "What force or what fortune 92 drove you so far from Campaldino, 93 that your burial place was never known?"
query.result: 91 And ic to him: "Hwilc mægen oððe hwilc gesælð 92 ðe dræfde swa feor fram Campaldino, 93 ðæt ðin byrgen næfre man ne wiste?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 «Oh!», rispuos’ elli, «a piè del Casentino 95 traversa un’acqua c’ha nome l’Archiano, 96 che sovra l’Ermo nasce in Apennino.
query.error: **English:** 94 "Oh!" he replied, "at the foot of Casentino 95 there flows a river called the Archiano, 96 which rises in the Apennines above the Arno.
query.result: 94 "Eala!" cwæð he, "æt ðæs Casentines fótum 95 ðurhflów ða ea ðe is haten ðe Archiano, 96 ðe ofer ðone Ermon on ðæm Apennine spryngð."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Là ’ve ’l vocabol suo diventa vano, 98 arriva’ io forato ne la gola, 99 fuggendo a piede e sanguinando il piano.
query.error: **English:** 97 There where its vocabulary fails, 98 I arrived, pierced in the throat, 99 fleeing on foot and staining the plain with blood.
query.result: 97 Þær ðær his word geweorðað wæstm, 98 ic com ðær ðurh ðone hals forwundod, 99 fleonde on fotum and ðone feld blodigende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Quivi perdei la vista e la parola; 101 nel nome di Maria fini’, e quivi 102 caddi, e rimase la mia carne sola.
query.error: **English:** 100 There I lost sight and speech; 101 in the name of Mary I ended, and there 102 I fell, and my flesh remained alone.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Io dirò vero, e tu ’l ridì tra ’ vivi: 104 l’angel di Dio mi prese, e quel d’inferno 105 gridava: “O tu del ciel, perché mi privi?
query.error: **English:** 103 I will tell you the truth, and you repeat it among the living: 104 the angel of God took me, and the one from hell 105 cried out: “O you of heaven, why do you deprive me?
query.result: 103 Ic secge ðe soð, and ðu hit secge ðam lybbendum: 104 ðæs Godes engel nam me, and ðæs helle gast 105 cleopode: “Eala ðu of heofenum, hwi benimeð ðu me?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Tu te ne porti di costui l’etterno 107 per una lagrimetta che ’l mi toglie; 108 ma io farò de l’altro altro governo!”.
query.error: **English:** 106 You carry away from me the eternal soul of this man 107 for a single tear that he sheds; 108 but I will make other arrangements for him!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Ben sai come ne l’aere si raccoglie 110 quell’ umido vapor che in acqua riede, 111 tosto che sale dove ’l freddo il coglie.
query.error: **English:** 109 I know well how in the air is gathered 110 that moist vapor which turns back into water, 111 as soon as it rises to where the cold seizes it.
query.result: 109 Ic wat ful georne hu ne on lyfte gæð 110 se wæta wylm ðe on wæter bið, 111 sona swa he gæð ðær him ceald begegnð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Giunse quel mal voler che pur mal chiede 113 con lo ’ntelletto, e mosse il fummo e ’l vento 114 per la virtù che sua natura diede.

query.result: 112 ða com se yfla will ðe ðurh yfel wile 113 mid ðam mode, and ðone smec and ðone wind 114 ðurh ða mihte ðe him his gecynd geaf.

121 e come ai rivi grandi si convenne, 122 ver’ lo fiume real tanto veloce 123 si ruinò, che nulla la ritenne.

127 ch’i’ fe’ di me quando ’l dolor mi vinse; 128 voltòmmi per le ripe e per lo fondo, 129 poi di sua preda mi coperse e cinse».

136 disposando m’avea con la sua gemma».
